name: Maloya
description: Originated in slave communities on La Réunion; based on a call and response structure and use of traditional instruments.

children.name: Maloya électronique
children.description: Combines the 6/8 ternary rhythm with Electronic production, using computer music, synthesizers and drum machines.

children.name: Maloya élektrik
children.description: Prominent in La Réunion island from the 1970s until the 1990s; drew influences from Funk, Psychedelia, and Afrobeat.

children.name: Traditional Maloya
children.description: Derived from Traditional Séga, this is the original dance music of La Réunion.
